column4: hi, my /etc/fstab loads the d drive but I can not write into the drive , any help?
paste your /etc/fstab on paste.ubuntu.com and highlight which one is the d drive
I have a FAT32 drive and the options line is "utf8,umask=000,fmask=111,gid=46,shortname=mixed"
dunno which of them are included in the current one
well let me try with your options
to test it:   sudo umount /dev/sda5; sudo mount -a
group id = 46, it means that the owner of the disk is the "plugdev" group
maybe it's different on other machines... no idea
I will reboot and get back to you, I have a bad experience to see things stop working after reboot
thanks pal, it worked this time, I have spent more than 4 hours on it :-)
